title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Timothy chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Timothy Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:1, what shall come in the last days?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:1 states that in the last days perilous times shall come.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a characteristic of men in 2 Timothy 3:2?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:2 lists characteristics including lovers of their own selves, covetous, and boasters, but not humble.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:4, men in the last days will be lovers of what more than lovers of God?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:4 says they will be lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God.

questions.question: What should we do with those who have a form of godliness but deny its power, according to 2 Timothy 3:5?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:5 instructs to turn away from those who have a form of godliness but deny the power thereof.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 3:6, who do those described creep into houses to lead captive?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:6 mentions they creep into houses and lead captive silly women laden with sins.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:7, what is the condition of those who are ever learning?
options: Never able to come to the knowledge of the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Never able to come to the knowledge of the truth
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:7 states they are ever learning but never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

questions.question: Who are compared with those who resist the truth in 2 Timothy 3:8?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:8 compares those resisting the truth to Jannes and Jambres who withstood Moses.

questions.question: Where did Paul face persecutions as mentioned in 2 Timothy 3:11?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:11 lists persecutions endured at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:12, who shall suffer persecution?
options: All that will live godly in Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: All that will live godly in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:12 says all who live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

questions.question: What will evil men and seducers do according to 2 Timothy 3:13?
options: Wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived
questions.correctAnswer: Wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:13 states evil men and seducers will wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Timothy 3:15 says the holy scriptures are able to make one wise unto salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:15 clearly states the holy scriptures make one wise unto salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:16, all scripture is profitable for which of the following?
options: Doctrine, reproof, correction, instruction in righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Doctrine, reproof, correction, instruction in righteousness
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:16 states all scripture is profitable for doctrine, reproof, correction, and instruction in righteousness.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Timothy 3:9 says the folly of those who resist the truth shall be hidden from all men.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:9 says their folly shall be manifest unto all men, not hidden.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 2 Timothy 3:17: 'That the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all ______ works.'
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:17 states that the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Timothy 3:14 advises to continue in the things learned, knowing of whom they were learned.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:14 instructs to continue in the things learned and assured of, knowing from whom they were learned.

medium.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Timothy Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on 2 Timothy 3, what biblical truth would you share about enduring hardships?
options: Persecution is to be expected for those who live godly in Christ Jesus.
God will always remove all trials immediately.
Trials only come to those who lack faith.
Suffering is a sign that God is displeased with you.
questions.correctAnswer: Persecution is to be expected for those who live godly in Christ Jesus.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:12 teaches that all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution, encouraging believers to endure trials faithfully. This is supported by Paul's example in verses 10-11 where he endured persecutions but was delivered by the Lord.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 3 instruct Christians to respond to people who have 'a form of godliness, but deny the power thereof'?
options: Ignore the problem and stay silent.
Support their actions to maintain peace.
questions.explanation: Verse 5 advises believers to turn away from those who have a form of godliness but deny its power, warning against association with such people as they can lead others astray.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 3 say about the source and purpose of Scripture for Christian living?
options: All Scripture is inspired by God and profitable for doctrine, reproof, correction, and instruction in righteousness.
Only some parts of Scripture are inspired and useful.
Scripture is mainly historical and not practical for daily life.
Scripture should be interpreted based on personal opinion.
questions.correctAnswer: All Scripture is inspired by God and profitable for doctrine, reproof, correction, and instruction in righteousness.
questions.explanation: Verse 16 emphasizes that all Scripture is God-breathed and useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting, and training in righteousness, which equips believers for good works (verse 17).

questions.question: A believer is struggling with false teachers who resist the truth. According to 2 Timothy 3, what characteristic do these false teachers share?
options: They have corrupt minds and are reprobate concerning the faith.
They are humble and open to correction.
They seek to build the church up.
They are eager to learn and grow in truth.
questions.correctAnswer: They have corrupt minds and are reprobate concerning the faith.
questions.explanation: Verse 8 describes those resisting the truth as having corrupt minds and being reprobate in faith, similar to Jannes and Jambres opposing Moses.

questions.question: Based on 2 Timothy 3, how should a Christian who has been taught sound doctrine continue in their faith?
options: Continue in the things learned and from whom they learned them.
Forget past teachings and seek new ideas.
Ignore teachings and rely on feelings.
questions.correctAnswer: Continue in the things learned and from whom they learned them.
questions.explanation: Verse 14 instructs believers to continue in what they have learned and are assured of, acknowledging the trustworthy source of their teaching.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 3 say about the progression of evil men and seducers in the last days?
options: They shall wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
They will eventually repent and change.
They will be quickly removed from the church.
questions.correctAnswer: They shall wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
questions.explanation: Verse 13 warns that evil men and seducers will grow worse over time, spreading deception and being misled themselves.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 3, men in the last days will be lovers of God more than lovers of pleasures.
questions.explanation: Verse 4 states that men will be lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God, indicating a selfish and pleasure-driven attitude in the last days.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 3 describe those who are 'ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth'?
options: They are like those led away with divers lusts and sins.
They are mature and wise in faith.
They are full of the Holy Spirit.
They are examples of steadfast believers.
questions.correctAnswer: They are like those led away with divers lusts and sins.
questions.explanation: Verse 7 describes this group as those who creep into houses and lead captive silly women laden with sins, ever learning but never coming to the truth.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3, what attributes did Paul exemplify that Timothy was encouraged to follow?
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 list Paul's manner of life and qualities, including doctrine, faith, longsuffering, charity, and patience, which Timothy was encouraged to imitate.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for ______, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness.'
questions.explanation: Verse 16 teaches that Scripture is inspired by God and is profitable for doctrine, reproof, correction, and instruction, making it essential for Christian growth.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Timothy 3 teaches that a godly life will inevitably avoid persecution.
questions.explanation: Verse 12 explains that all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution, showing that godliness does not exempt one from trials.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3, what is the benefit of knowing and continuing in the holy scriptures from childhood?
options: They are able to make wise unto salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
They are useful for cultural understanding.
questions.correctAnswer: They are able to make wise unto salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states that the holy scriptures are able to make one wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus, highlighting their spiritual benefit.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 3 describe the times in the last days?
options: Peaceful and prosperous times will prevail.
Everyone will be united in faith.
questions.explanation: Verse 1 warns that in the last days perilous times shall come, indicating challenges and difficulties for believers.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 3 say about the character of people in the last days?
options: They will be lovers of themselves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy.
They will be humble, generous, and thankful.
They will prioritize God over pleasures.
They will be peacemakers and patient.
questions.correctAnswer: They will be lovers of themselves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy.
questions.explanation: Verses 2-4 describe in detail the selfish and sinful behaviors that characterize people in the last days.

questions.question: A Christian is seeking to be fully equipped for good works. Based on 2 Timothy 3, how does Scripture help in this?
options: Scripture makes the man of God perfect and thoroughly furnished unto all good works.
Scripture is irrelevant to good works.
Good works come from human effort without Scripture.
Only church leaders need Scripture for good works.
questions.correctAnswer: Scripture makes the man of God perfect and thoroughly furnished unto all good works.
questions.explanation: Verse 17 teaches that through Scripture a believer is made perfect and fully equipped for every good work, showing the practical value of God’s Word.

hard.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Timothy Chapter 3.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 3:1, what phrase is used to describe the nature of the times in the last days?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:1 explicitly states that 'in the last days perilous times shall come,' indicating a period of danger and difficulty.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed among the characteristics of people in the last days in 2 Timothy 3:2-4?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:2-4 describes people as 'lovers of their own selves' and 'lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God,' indicating a decline in genuine love for God.

questions.question: What is the apostle Paul’s instruction regarding those who have 'a form of godliness but deny the power thereof' according to 2 Timothy 3:5?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:5 commands believers to 'turn away' from those who only have an appearance of godliness but deny its power, emphasizing separation.

questions.question: 2 Timothy 3:6 mentions people who 'creep into houses and lead captive silly women laden with sins.' What does this imply about the methods used by false teachers?
options: They preach only in public places
questions.explanation: The phrase 'creep into houses' suggests stealthy and manipulative tactics used by false teachers to gain influence, as described in 2 Timothy 3:6.

questions.question: Who are Jannes and Jambres mentioned in 2 Timothy 3:8, and what is their significance in relation to resisting the truth?
questions.explanation: Jannes and Jambres are traditionally identified as the magicians who opposed Moses in Egypt, symbolizing opposition to God's truth as referenced in 2 Timothy 3:8.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:10-11, what are some qualities Paul says Timothy has fully known from Paul’s own example?
questions.explanation: Paul highlights Timothy’s knowledge of his doctrine and virtues such as faith, longsuffering, charity, and patience as seen in 2 Timothy 3:10-11.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 3:12 say about those who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus?
options: They will be exempt from trials
They will be honored by all
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:12 states that persecution is a certainty for all who live godly in Christ Jesus, underscoring the cost of faithful living.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 2 Timothy 3:13, evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, ______ and being deceived.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:13 describes evil men as both deceiving others and being deceived themselves, highlighting a downward spiral.

questions.question: What does Paul urge Timothy to do in 2 Timothy 3:14 in relation to the teachings he has received?
options: Continue in the things which thou hast learned
questions.correctAnswer: Continue in the things which thou hast learned
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts Timothy to remain steadfast in the teachings and assurances he has received, as recorded in 2 Timothy 3:14.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:15, what is the purpose of the holy scriptures known from childhood?
options: To make wise unto salvation through faith in Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: To make wise unto salvation through faith in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: The scriptures are described as able to impart wisdom leading to salvation through faith in Christ, as declared in 2 Timothy 3:15.

questions.question: 2 Timothy 3:16 declares that all scripture is profitable for four specific purposes. Which of the following is NOT one of them?
questions.explanation: While scripture contains prophecy, 2 Timothy 3:16 lists doctrine, reproof, correction, and instruction in righteousness as its direct purposes.

questions.question: What is the ultimate goal for the man of God as stated in 2 Timothy 3:17?
options: To be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works
questions.correctAnswer: To be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:17 describes the goal of scripture’s instruction as equipping the man of God to be complete and ready for good works.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 3:7, some people are ever learning but never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:7 states that certain individuals are always learning yet never able to understand the truth, indicating futile study.

questions.question: How does the contrast between 'lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God' in 2 Timothy 3:4 reflect a recurring biblical theme seen in the prophets?
options: It echoes Israel's idolatry and neglect of God’s covenant
It supports indulgence as a virtue
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes Israel's idolatry and neglect of God’s covenant
questions.explanation: The preference for pleasure over God echoes prophetic critiques of Israel’s idolatry and faithlessness, a theme throughout the Old Testament.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 3:11, Paul mentions persecutions at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. What historical context does this give for the early Christian experience?
options: Early Christians faced repeated persecution in different cities
questions.correctAnswer: Early Christians faced repeated persecution in different cities
questions.explanation: Paul’s mention of persecutions at multiple locations reflects the widespread opposition the early church encountered, consistent with Acts.

theological.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Timothy Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3, what is a characteristic of people in the last days?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:2 describes people in the last days as 'lovers of their own selves.' Similar warnings about selfishness appear in Romans 1:29, Proverbs 18:1, and James 4:1-3, underscoring human sinful nature apart from God.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 3:5 say we should do when encountering those who have a form of godliness but deny its power?
questions.explanation: The verse commands to 'turn away' from those who have a form of godliness but deny its power. This aligns with biblical teaching to avoid false teachers (Romans 16:17, Titus 3:10) who corrupt the truth and lead others astray.

questions.question: Who are Jannes and Jambres mentioned in 2 Timothy 3:8 as resisting the truth?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 3:8 refers to Jannes and Jambres, traditionally known as Egyptian magicians who opposed Moses. Their resistance to God's truth parallels the opposition Paul experienced, echoing Exodus 7:11-12 and 2 Thessalonians 2:9-10 about deceivers.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3, what is the ultimate outcome for those who resist the truth as Jannes and Jambres did?
options: Their folly shall be manifest to all men
questions.correctAnswer: Their folly shall be manifest to all men
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states their foolishness becomes evident to all, showing divine judgment on false teachers. This reflects God's justice in Proverbs 26:11, Isaiah 29:16, and Galatians 6:7.

questions.question: What qualities of Paul does 2 Timothy 3:10 highlight that Timothy has fully known?
options: Doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience
questions.correctAnswer: Doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience
questions.explanation: Paul lists these virtues as examples for Timothy, emphasizing spiritual maturity and endurance (2 Timothy 3:10). Similar characteristics are encouraged in Galatians 5:22-23, Colossians 1:11, and James 5:7-8.

questions.question: What does 2 Timothy 3:11 teach about the persecutions Paul endured?
options: Paul was delivered by the Lord from all persecutions
Paul was defeated by his enemies
questions.correctAnswer: Paul was delivered by the Lord from all persecutions
questions.explanation: Paul recounts persecution at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra but declares the Lord delivered him, illustrating divine protection and faithfulness (Psalm 34:19, Daniel 3:17-18, Acts 18:9-10).

questions.question: What warning does 2 Timothy 3:12 give to those who live godly in Christ Jesus?
options: They will be praised by all
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that all who desire to live godly will face persecution. This is consistent with Jesus' teaching in John 15:18-20, 1 Peter 4:12-16, and Matthew 5:10-12.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 3:13, what is the progression of evil men and seducers?
options: They grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived
They repent and turn to the truth
questions.correctAnswer: They grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived
questions.explanation: The verse highlights a worsening spiritual condition where deception amplifies. This aligns with warnings in Romans 1:28, Matthew 24:12, and 2 Thessalonians 2:10 about apostasy increasing before Christ's return.

questions.question: What does Paul exhort Timothy to do in 2 Timothy 3:14?
options: Continue in the things he has learned and been assured of
questions.correctAnswer: Continue in the things he has learned and been assured of
questions.explanation: Paul encourages steadfastness in true doctrine and teaching. This perseverance is essential for faithfulness, as seen in Hebrews 3:14, Colossians 2:6-7, and 1 Corinthians 15:58.

questions.question: From what age has Timothy known the holy scriptures, according to 2 Timothy 3:15?
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges Timothy's lifelong familiarity with Scripture, which is able to make one wise unto salvation. This underscores the importance of early spiritual education, supported by Proverbs 22:6 and Deuteronomy 6:6-7.

questions.question: What is the source of all scripture according to 2 Timothy 3:16?
questions.explanation: Verse 16 teaches that all scripture is God-breathed, affirming divine origin. This doctrine is foundational and echoed in 2 Peter 1:21, Psalm 119:105, and Hebrews 4:12.

questions.question: For what purposes is scripture profitable according to 2 Timothy 3:16?
options: Doctrine, reproof, correction, instruction in righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Doctrine, reproof, correction, instruction in righteousness
questions.explanation: Scripture equips believers for teaching, rebuking, correcting, and training in righteousness, fulfilling the role of spiritual formation. This is consistent with Psalm 19:7-11, Proverbs 3:11-12, and Romans 15:4.

questions.question: What is the intended result for the man of God who uses scripture according to 2 Timothy 3:17?
options: That he may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works
That he may gain wealth and fame
questions.correctAnswer: That he may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works
questions.explanation: The passage teaches that Scripture prepares believers completely for a godly life and service. This perfection is spiritual maturity, as seen in Ephesians 4:11-13, Colossians 1:28, and James 1:4.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 2 Timothy 3:4 describes people in the last days as lovers of pleasures more than lovers of _____.
questions.explanation: Verse 4 states they are 'lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God,' highlighting spiritual decline contrasting with true devotion. This contrast is echoed in Matthew 6:24 and Jeremiah 2:13.

questions.question: What is said in 2 Timothy 3:7 about certain individuals' learning and knowledge?
options: Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth
Quick to learn and wise in the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth
questions.explanation: This describes those who continually study but fail to grasp saving truth, similar to warnings in Hebrews 5:12-14 and Proverbs 1:22 about hardness of heart and rejection of God's word.
